title:
Overlapping subspaces and singular systems with application to
  Isogeometric Analysis
authors: Andrea Bressan and Massimiliano Martinelli and Giancarlo Sangalli
abstract:
We propose a framework for solving partial differential equations (PDEs)
motivated by isogeometric analysis (IGA) and local tensor-product splines.
Instead of using a global basis for the solution space we use as generators the
disjoint union of subspace bases. This leads to a potentially singular linear
system, which is handled by a Krylov linear solver. The framework may offer
computational advantages in dealing with spaces like Hierarchical B-splines,
T-splines, and LR-splines.
